author: gurukamath
content: That coverage report was generated by running the json fixtures against EELS

author: danceratopz
content: Makese sense. Do you have a command for EELS to do that?

author: gurukamath
content:
Update this [line](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/e33bb9a8b4b6a4898bd19f731685e38c366817cc/tests/helpers/__init__.py#L26) to point to the appropriate json fixtures containing all the tests you want to run.

Then
```
pytest -m "not slow" -n auto --maxprocesses 10 --cov-config=pyproject.toml --cov=ethereum --cov-report=term --cov-report "xml:coverage.xml" --no-cov-on-fail --cov-branch --ignore-glob='tests/fixtures/*'
```

author: txtiger
content: Thank you, this makes my life significantly easier.
